column2: 2001 年，段崇智离开托马斯杰斐逊大学，在美国国家卫生研究院之一的关节炎、肌肉骨骼及皮肤病国家研究院（NIAMD）担任院内研究职位，成为新成立的软骨生物学和骨科分部的负责人。

column1: Eight years later, he and his wife, fellow NIH scientist Cecilia Lo, were recruited to the University of Pittsburgh, where Tuan joined the departments of orthopaedic surgery and bioengineering and became the founding director of the newly established Center for Cellular and Molecular Engineering.
column2: 八年后，他及妻子（同为美国国家卫生研究院科学家的罗闻亚）受聘来到匹兹堡大学，段崇智加入该校整形外科系和生物工程系，成为新建立的细胞及分子工程中心的创始主任。

column1: He was appointed the Arthur J. Rooney Sr.
column2: 他被任命为 Arthur J. Rooney Sr.

column1: Professor of Sports Medicine in 2010.
column2: 运动医学教授，时间为 2010 年。

column1: Two years later, he assumed the directorship of the University of Pittsburgh's Center for Military Medicine Research and associate directorship of the McGowan Institute for Regenerative Medicine.
column2: 两年后，他担任匹兹堡大学军事医学研究中心主任和麦高恩再生医学研究所副主任。

column1: Tuan is a founding editor-in-chief of the scientific journal Stem Cell Research & Therapy and the editor of Birth Defects Research Part C: Embryo Today.
column2: 段崇智是科学期刊《干细胞研究与治疗》的创始主编，也是《出生研究 C部分：今日胚胎》的编辑。

column1: He and Lo co-edited a three-volume book titled Developmental Biology Protocols.
column2: 他与罗闻亚共同编辑了三卷本《发育生物学协议》一书。

column1: In 2017, Tuan was appointed as the eighth vice-chancellor and president of the Chinese University of Hong Kong in his native city.
column2: 2017 年，段崇智被任命为其家乡香港中文大学的第八任校长。

column1: He took up the post in January 2018. During the 2019 Hong Kong protests, he was condemned by CUHK students for failing to criticise police excesses but later won plaudits after an evening-long discussion with them in public and private.
column2: 他于 2018 年 1 月就任。在 2019 年香港修例风波中，他因没有批评警方的过度行为而受到中大（CUHK）学生指责，但后来在公开及私下与学生进行一个晚上的讨论后，赢得了赞誉。

column1: Tuan's research group focuses on bioengineering and tissue regeneration as applied to the musculoskeletal system, with an interest in translational research.
column2: 段崇智的研究小组专注于应用到肌肉骨骼系统的生物工程和组织再生，并对转化研究感兴趣。

column1: Tuan's group has expertise in the study of adult stem cells and in the development of the musculoskeletal system.
column2: 段崇智的小组在成人干细胞研究和肌肉骨骼系统发育方面有专长。

column1: Among their efforts is a research project aimed at using 3D printing technology to restore function of joints damaged by diseases such as osteoarthritis, and work funded in 2016 to study model systems on the International Space Station.
column2: 在他们的成果中，有一项研究项目旨在利用 3D 打印技术来恢复因骨关节炎等疾病而受损的关节功能，还有 2016 年获得资助的研究国际空间站模型系统的工作。

column1: The airport was built in 1936 during Japanese rule with its origins as a Japanese military airbase, the Taihoku Airfield (Japanese: 臺北飛行場 Hepburn: Taihoku Hikōjō), also known as Matsuyama Airfield (松山飛行場).
column2: 该机场建于 1936 年日据时期，最初为日本军用空军基地“台北飞行场”，又称“松山飞行场”。

column1: After World War II, in 1946, it was taken over by the Republic of China Air Force.
column2: 二战后，于 1946 年由中华民国空军接管。

column1: Before the end of the Chinese Civil War and the establishment of the People's Republic of China, the airport provided flight routes between Shanghai and Taipei, occasionally via Fuzhou.
column2: 在国共内战结束和中华人民共和国成立之前，该机场提供上海与台北之间的航班，偶尔途经福州。

column1: Shared military and civilian use—both domestic and international—began on 16 April 1950 in the reconstructed Civil Aeronautics Administration Taipei Airport (交通部民用航空局台北航空站).
column2: 1950 年 4 月 16 日，在重建后的“交通部”民用航空局台北航空站开启军民共享，既有国内的也有国际的。

column1: Domestic destinations have been Kaohsiung, Hualien, Taichung, Penghu, and Tainan.
column2: 境内目的地有高雄、花莲、台中、澎湖和台南。

column1: The first international destinations were Seattle, Tokyo, Pusan, Manila, Bangkok, and Hong Kong.
column2: 第一批国际目的地为西雅图、东京、釜山、马尼拉、曼谷和香港。

column1: The first international airlines included Northwest Airlines, Pan American Airlines, and Hong Kong Airways (now Cathay Pacific).
column2: 首批国际航空公司包括西北航空、泛美航空和香港航空（现在的国泰航空）。

column1: Later, the airport became too small to handle an increased number of passengers, even after a series of expansions.
column2: 后来，即使经过一系列扩建，机场也不足以处理增加的乘客数量。

column1: This later worsened when new wide-body jets became common at the airport.
column2: 之后，当新的宽体式喷气飞机成为机场常客时，这种情况就恶化了。

column1: Therefore, all international activities were relocated to Taoyuan International Airport (then known as Chiang Kai-shek International) after its inauguration on 26 February 1979.
column2: 因此，1979 年 2 月 26 日桃园国际机场（当时名为中正国际机场）启用后，所有的国际活动都迁往该机场。

column1: Consequently, the passenger load at the airport dropped from 6.2 million in 1978 to 2.9 million in 1979 (a 53% decrease).
column2: 机场客运量因此从 1978 年的 620 万降至 1979 年的 290 万（减少53%）。

column1: At its peak in 1997, the airport handled over 15.3 million passengers annually.
column2: 在 1997 年的高峰期，该机场年处理 1530 多万旅客。

column1: Service to Taichung and Chiayi was stopped in mid-2007 after the load factor dropped significantly due to Taiwan High Speed Rail start of revenue service in January 2007.
column2: 由于台湾高铁从 2007 年 1 月开始提供收入服务，使得载客率大幅下降，至台中和嘉义的服务于 2007 年中停止。

column1: Passenger volume decreased from 6.7 million in 2006 to 4.4 million in 2007 (a 34% decrease).
column2: 客运量从 2006 年的 670 万减少到 2007 年的 440 万（减少34%）。

column1: Also due to the opening of the high speed rail line, on 1 March 2008, Uni Air suspended its service to Kaohsiung, while Far Eastern Air Transport suspended its service to Tainan.
column2: 同样由于高铁线路开通，2008年1月立荣航空暂停了至高雄的服务，而远东航空也暂停了至台南的服务。

column1: TransAsia Airways decided to stop flights to Tainan and Kaohsiung after 1 August 2008.
column2: 复兴航空决定 2008 年 8 月 1 日之后，停飞至台南和高雄的航班。

column1: In early 1999 when the construction of Taipei 101 had just started, Taiwan's Civil Aeronautics Administration changed this airport's certain SID and STAR procedures to avoid possible collision with the building.
column2: 1999 年初，当台北 101 大厦刚开始动工时，台湾的交通部民用航空局更改了该机场的某些 SID 和 STAR 程序，以避免与该楼相撞。

column1: The 677-meter Fuxing North Road Underground Passage (復興北路車行地下道) was constructed between 1997 and 2006 under this airport's runway to link the north and south side of this airport.
column2: 677 米长的复兴北路车行地下道从 1997 年至 2006 年修建于该机场跑道地下，用于连接该机场南北两侧。

column1: Regular cross-Strait charter flights to China started on 4 July 2008, with Songshan receiving the majority of flights.
column2: 2008 年 7 月 4 日，两岸定期包机开通，松山机场接收大部分航班。

column1: Direct flights to China were an issue of contention.
column2: 至中国大陆的直飞航班是一个有争议的问题。

column1: Then-mayor Ma Ying-jeou had been pressing to make Songshan Airport Taipei's main International terminal, citing that its location close to the city center would make it preferable for business travelers.
column2: 时任市长马英九一直极力要求把松山机场作为台北的主要国际航站楼，理由是其位置靠近市中心，更适合商旅人士。

column1: However, building height restrictions around the airport raised concerns about flight safety, blocking of radio communications, noise pollution, and a reduced number of flights.
column2: 但机场周围的建筑高度限制，引起人们对飞行安全、无线电通讯受阻、噪音污染和航班数量减少的担忧。

column1: The continuing growth of Taipei City means that Songshan airport is situated in the heart of downtown Taipei.
column2: 台北市的持续增长意味着松山机场坐落于台北市中心的核心地带。

column1: Compared to Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport, Songshan Airport saves travelers about 30 minutes due to its location inside Taipei City's central business district, but the city suffers from the noise, pollution, restrictions on urban planning, and traffic congestion the airport brings about.
column2: 与台湾桃园国际机场相比，由于在台北市的中央商务区内，松山机场可为旅客节省约30分钟时间，但该市却饱受机场带来的噪音、污染、城市规划限制和交通拥堵的困扰。

column1: In the 2002 and 2006 Taipei Mayor Election DPP candidates Lee Ying-yuan and Frank Hsieh both proposed the plan to close Songshan Airport, and developed its land into road, huge park, detention basin and sports arena, since the Taiwan High Speed Rail could quickly take up the traffic load between Taipei and western Taiwan cities, and the remaining service to outlying islands and eastern Taiwan could be easily taken over by the Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport after the completion of Taoyuan International Airport Access MRT System by the end of 2016.
column2: 在 2002 年和 2006 年的台北市长选举中，民进党候选人李应元和谢长廷都提议关闭松山机场，并将其土地开发为道路、大型公园、泄洪池以及体育场，理由是台湾高铁可以迅速承担起台北和台湾西部城市之间的交通负荷，而到2016年底，桃园国际机场通道捷运系统建成后，其余至离岛和台湾东部的服务可由台湾桃园国际机场轻松承担。

column1: Also, the MRT system will make the international potential of Songshan airport less attractive.
column2: 此外，捷运系统将令松山机场的国际潜力失去吸引力。

column1: The Songshan Airport closing proposal was deferred under the Taipei City Government which has long been dominated by the Pan-Blue Coalition, who prefers the downtown airport connection concept with Shanghai, Seoul, and Tokyo.
column2: 关闭松山机场的提案被台北市政府推迟，该市政府长期以来一直由泛蓝联盟主导，他们更倾向于上海、首尔和东京的市中心机场连接的概念。

column1: Due to the introduction of Taiwan-China flights and future international potential, the airport is undergoing extensive renovations, the first phase of which is expected to be completed by October 2010.
column2: 由于开通两岸航班和未来的国际潜力，该机场正在进行大范围翻修，第一阶段预计将在 2010 年 10 月完成。

column1: The second and third phase renovations are expected to be completed by March and October 2011, respectively.
column2: 预计第二和第三阶段的翻新工程将分别于 2011 年 3 月和 10 月完成。

column1: However, as of November 2011 renovations are still in progress.
column2: 但截至 2011 年 11 月，翻新工作仍在进行。

column1: A new international cargo terminal is being built in anticipation of a new air route between Taiwan and Japan.
column2: 为迎接台湾与日本之间的新航线，正在建设一座新的国际货运航站楼。

column1: The unused Terminal 2 was refurbished to accommodate arriving flights while the main Terminal, now Terminal 1, was rearranged to handle increased passenger traffic.
column2: 未使用的 2 号航站楼进行了翻新，用于停靠到达航班，而主航站楼即现在的 1 号航站楼，经重新安排后用于处理增加的客流量。

column1: On 29 March 2011, the renovated Terminal 2 was re-opened to handle domestic flights.
column2: 2011 年 3 月 29 日，翻修一新的 2 号航站楼重新开放，用于接待国内航班。

column1: Songshan Airport is seen to have the potential to attract business travelers within Pacific Asia due to its location in downtown Taipei.
column2: 由于地处台北市中心，松山机场被认为有潜力吸引亚太地区的商务旅客。

column1: Flights to Bangkok–Don Mueang, Jakarta–Halim Perdanakusuma, Kuala Lumpur–Subang, Singapore–Seletar, Nagoya–Komaki, Osaka–Itami, Seoul–Gimpo, Shanghai–Hongqiao, Beijing–Nanyuan, and Tokyo–Haneda are especially attractive since these airports are also in the central areas of their respective cities, and all these cities have larger far flung international airports.
column2: 前往曼谷-廊曼机场、雅加达-哈利姆·珀达纳库苏马机场、吉隆坡-梳邦机场、新加坡-实里达机场、名古屋-小牧机场、大阪-伊丹机场、首尔-金浦机场、上海-虹桥机场、北京-南苑机场、东京-羽田机场的航班特别吸引人，因为这些机场也都位于各自城市的中心地区，所有这些城市都有更大更远的国际机场。

column1: The airport is currently in the process of expansion to better accommodate international flights.
column2: 机场目前正在扩建，以便更好地适应国际航班。

column1: On 6 March 2009, Japan and Taiwan signed a Memorandum of Understanding on the revision of Taiwan–Japan bilateral traffic.
column2: 2009 年 3 月 6 日，日本与台湾签署了一份关于修改台日双边交通的谅解备忘录。

column1: Four carriers (EVA Air, China Airlines, Japan Airlines, and ANA) would be able to operate from Songshan Airport to Tokyo–Haneda.
column2: 四家航空公司（长荣航空、中华航空、日本航空和全日空）将能够开展从松山机场到东京羽田机场的运营服务。

column1: In December 2009, an affirmative schedule for the route between Tokyo–Haneda and Taipei–Songshan was announced.
column2: 2009 年 12 月，公布了东京羽田至台北松山航线的确定时刻表。

column1: Starting in October 2010, EVA Air, China Airlines, Japan Airlines, and ANA each operates two flights a day from Taipei–Songshan to Tokyo–Haneda, with China Airlines and EVA Air both utilizing the Airbus A330-300 on the route.
column2: 从 2010 年 10 月起，长荣航空、华航、日航和全日空每天各有两个航班从台北松山前往东京羽田，华航和长荣航空在这条航线上均使用空客 A330-300。

column1: Japan Airlines and ANA began this route with the Boeing 767.
column2: 日航和全日空在这条航线上使用波音 767。

column1: Both ANA and Japan Airlines have phased in the newer Boeing 787-8 on the route beginning in 2013 and 2014, respectively.
column2: 全日空和日航分别从 2013 年和 2014 年开始，在这条航线上启用新型波音 787-8。

column1: Japan Airlines also uses the Boeing 777-200 on this route.
column2: 日航在这条航线上也使用波音 777-200。

column1: On 14 June 2010, direct flights between Taipei–Songshan and Shanghai–Hongqiao began.
column2: 2010 年 6 月 14 日，台北松山至上海虹桥的直飞航班开通。

column1: Each week has 28 flights, served by China Eastern Airlines, Shanghai Airlines, Air China, China Airlines, EVA Air, and TransAsia Airways.
column2: 每周 28 个航班，由中国东方航空、上海航空、中国国际航空、中华航空、长荣航空和复兴航空执飞。

column1: The airport will undergo upgrades to its runway and reduce its jet bridges from eight to six to accommodate wider contemporary aircraft such as the Airbus A330 and Boeing 767.
column2: 机场将对跑道进行升级，并将登机桥从 8 座减少到 6 座，以容纳尺寸更宽的现代飞机，比如空客 A330 和波音 767。

column1: The airport is served by the Taipei Metro Neihu Line's Songshan Airport Station.
column2: 机场由台北捷运内湖线的松山机场站提供服务。

column1: The TRA Songshan Airport Line also formerly served Songshan Airport from 1936 until 1976.
column2: 1936 年至 1976 年，台铁（TRA）松山飞机场线也曾为松山机场提供服务。

column1: Several city buses also serve this airport, providing frequent links to the Tamsui Line and Wenshan Line of the Taipei Metro.
column2: 该机场也有多辆市区巴士，提供至台北捷运淡水线和文山线的服务。

column1: The first suncakes were made by the Lin family in the She-Ko area of Shengang Township, Taichung County (now part of Taichung City).
column2: 第一批太阳饼由台中县（现属台中市）神岗乡社高地区的林氏家族制作。

column1: The Lin family used condensed malt sugar as a filling for cake pastries.
column2: 林家使用浓缩麦芽糖作为糕点馅料。

column1: Later on, pastry maker Wei Qing-hai modified the cakes to their current form.
column2: 后来糕点师魏清海将糕点改良成现在的样子。

column1: Though not originally called "suncakes", they were given the name by the owner of "Sun Booth", one of the most famous pastry shops that sells them.
column2: 虽然最初并不叫“太阳饼”，这个名称由最著名糕饼店之一的太阳堂的老板所起，太阳堂也出售太阳饼。

column1: The name was not trademarked, and other pastry shops have used the same name for their own suncakes.
column2: 这个名称并未注册商标，其他糕饼店对自家的太阳饼也使用同样的名称。

column1: Shenyang literally means "the Yang side of the Shen River", referring to the location of the Hun River (formerly called the Shen River, 瀋水; Shěn Shuǐ), on the southern side of the city.
column2: 沈阳的字面意思是“沈河的阳面”，指的是浑河（以前叫“沈水”）的位置，位于城市南面。

column1: According to Chinese tradition, a river's north bank and a mountain's south slope are considered to be the "sunny" – or "Yang" – side.
column2: 根据中国传统，河的北岸和山的南坡被视为“阳”面。

column1: Archaeological findings show that humans resided in present-day Shenyang as early as 8,000 years ago.
column2: 考古发现表明，早在 8000 年前就有人类居住在今天的沈阳。

column1: The remains of the Xinle culture, a late neolithic period society over 6,800–7,200 years old, are located in a museum in the north part of Huanggu District.
column2: 新乐文化是 6800-7200 多年前新石器时代晚期的社会，其遗址位于皇姑区北部的一座博物馆。

column1: It is complemented by a recreated village on site.
column2: 与后来建造的一座村庄相辅相成。

column1: A wood-sculptured bird unearthed there is the earliest cultural relic in Shenyang, as well as one of oldest wood sculptures found anywhere in the world.
column2: 从那里出土的一只木雕鸟是沈阳最早的文物，也是世界上发现的最古老的木雕之一。

column1: The city, now known as Shenyang, was first established in about 300 BCE during the Warring States period by Yan general Qin Kai, who conquered the Liaodong region, and was then named Hou City (侯城; Hóu Chéng).
column2: 这座城市，也就是现在的沈阳，最早是在公元前300年战国时期，由征服辽东地区的燕国将领秦开建立，当时名为“侯城”。

column1: However, around 350 years later during the reign of Emperor Guangwu of Han, the city was sacked and burnt by the Donghu nomads and subsequently abandoned.
column2: 然而，大约 350 年后，这座城市在汉光武帝时期遭东胡游牧民族洗劫焚毁，随后被废弃。

column1: It came back to prominence during early Liao dynasty and was known as the Shen Prefecture (瀋州; Shěn Zhōu) through to the end of Jin dynasty, and became the Shenyang Circuit (瀋陽路; Shěnyáng Lù) during the Yuan dynasty.
column2: 辽代初期，这座城市又开始崭露头角，直至金朝末年，一直被称为“沈州”，在元朝时成为“沈阳路”。

column1: During the Ming dynasty, it was designated as a "guard town" (militarized settlements, such as walled/heavily garrisoned cities or towns) named Shenyang Central Guard (瀋陽中衛; Shěnyáng Zhōngwèi) and gradually became one of the most important strongholds beyond the Shanhai Pass.
column2: 明朝时，被指定为“卫城”（军事化的定居点，比如有城墙/重兵把守的城市或镇），名为“沈阳中卫”，逐渐成为山海关外最重要的据点之一。

column1: In 1625, the Manchu leader Nurhaci captured Shenyang and decided to relocate his entire administrative infrastructures to the city, or Simiyan hoton (Manchu: ᠰᡳᠮᡳᠶᠠᠨ
column2: 1625 年，满族首领努尔哈赤占领沈阳，决定将其全部行政基础设施迁至这座城市，也叫 Simiyan hoton（满语：ᠰᡳᠮᡳᠶᠠᠨ

column1: ᡥᠣᡨᠣᠨ) as it is called in Manchu language.
column2: ᡥᠣᡨᠣᠨ）按照其满语发音。

column1: The official name was changed to Shengjing (盛京; Shèng Jīng; 'rising capital'), or Mukden (Manchu: ᠮᡠᡴ᠋ᡩᡝᠨ), in 1634.
column2: 1634 年，官方名称改为“盛京”（“崛起的首都”），又叫“穆克敦”（满语：ᠮᡠᡴ᠋ᡩᡝᠨ）。

column1: The new name derives from the Manchu word, mukdembi (Manchu: ᠮᡠᡴ᠋ᡩᡝᠮᠪᡳ), meaning "to rise" as reflected also by its Han Chinese name.
column2: 新名称来自满语词汇 mukdembi （满语：ᠮᡠᡴ᠋ᡩᡝᠮᠪᡳ），意思是“上升”，这在其汉语名称中也有所体现。

column1: Under Nurhaci's orders, the Imperial Palace was constructed in 1626, symbolizing the city's emerging status as the Jurchen political center.
column2: 依照努尔哈赤的命令，沈阳故宫于 1626 年开建，象征该城作为女真政治中心的新兴地位。

column1: The palace featured more than 300 ostentatiously decorated rooms and 20 gardens as a symbol of power and grandeur.
column2: 这座宫殿有 300 多间装饰华丽的房间和 20 个花园，是权力和宏伟的象征。

column1: After the fall of the Ming dynasty in 1644 and the routing of the Shun army in the Battle of Shanhai Pass merely a day later, the Manchus successfully entered the Shanhai Pass to establish the Qing dynasty in China proper, with the capital relocated to Beijing.
column2: 1644 年明朝灭亡，仅仅一天之后，大顺军在山海关大战中被击溃，满族人成功进入山海关，在中国本土建立了清朝，首都迁至北京。

column1: However, Shenyang retained considerable importance as the secondary capital and the spiritual home of the Qing dynasty through the centuries.
column2: 但沈阳作为清朝的陪都和精神家园，几百年来一直保持相当重要的地位。

column1: Treasures of the royal house were kept at its palaces, and the tombs of the early Qing rulers were once among the most famous monuments in China.
column2: 皇室珍宝保存在宫殿中，前清统治者的陵墓曾是中国最著名的古迹之一。

column1: In 1657, Fengtian Prefecture (奉天府; Fèngtiān Fŭ; Manchu: ᠠᠪᡴᠠᡳ
column2: 1657 年，奉天府（满语：ᠠᠪᡴᠠᡳ

column1: ᡳᠮᡳᠶᠠᠩᡤᠠ
column2: ᡳᠮᡳᠶᠠᠩᡤᠠ

column1: ᡶᡠ; Möllendorff: abkai imiyangga fu; Abkai: abkai imiyangga fu or Manchu: ᡶᡠᠩ ᡨᡳᠶᠠᠨ; Möllendorff: fung tiyian; Abkai: fung tiyian) was established in the Shenyang area, and Fengtian (literally: 'mandated by Heaven') was sometimes used synonymously with Shenyang/Mukden.
column2: ᡶᡠ；莫兰多夫拼法：abkai imiyangga fu；太清转写：abkai imiyangga fu，或满语：ᡶᡠᠩ ᡨᡳᠶᠠᠨ；莫兰多夫拼法：fung tiyian；太清转写：fung tiyian）在沈阳地区建立，奉天（字面含义：“天命所归”）有时与沈阳/穆克敦同义。

column1: After the First Sino-Japanese War, Japan coerced the annexation of the Liaodong Peninsula with the Treaty of Shimonoseki in 1895, though was forced to give it up due to diplomatic pressure from the Triple Intervention.
column2: 甲午战争后，日本于 1895 年以《马关条约》胁迫吞并辽东半岛，但迫于三国干涉的外交压力而放弃。

column1: In the aftermath of the Japanese threat, Qing viceroy Li Hongzhang visited Moscow in 1896 and signed a secret treaty with Russian foreign minister Aleksey Lobanov-Rostovsky, allowing Imperial Russia to build a Russian gauge railway in Manchuria, which opened the door towards further Russian expansionism in the form of another lease convention in 1898, effectively allowing Russia to annex Port Arthur in all but name.
column2: 在被日本人威胁之后，清朝总督李鸿章于 1896 年出访莫斯科，与俄国外交大臣罗拔诺甫签订了一项秘密条约，允许沙皇俄国在满洲修建一条俄制轨距的铁路，这为俄国在 1898 年以另一项租约的形式进一步扩张打开了大门，实际上允许俄国在事实上吞并旅顺口。

column1: However, after the Boxer Rebellion in 1900, Russian forces used the anti-foreigner insurgency as a pretext to formally invade and occupied most of Manchuria, and Mukden became a Russian stronghold in the Far East with the building of the South Manchurian Railway.
column2: 但在 1900 年义和团运动之后，俄国军队以反外国人叛乱为借口，正式入侵并占领了满洲的大部分地区，随着南满铁路的修建，穆克敦成为俄国在远东地区的一个据点。

column1: During the Russo-Japanese War (1904—1905), Mukden was the site of the Battle of Mukden from February 19 to March 10, 1905. Involving more than 600,000 combat participants, it was the largest battle since the Battle of Leipzig in 1813, and also the largest modern-era battle ever fought in Asia before World War II.
column2: 日俄战争期间（1904-1905 年），穆克敦是 1905 年 2 月 19 日至 3 月 10 日奉天会战所在地。有 60 多万人参战，是自 1813 年莱比锡战役以来规模最大的一次战役，也是二战前亚洲打过的最大的一次现代战争。

column1: Following the Japanese victory, Mukden became one of the chief bases of Japanese presence and economic expansion into southern Manchuria.
column2: 日本胜利后，奉天成为日本在南满洲驻扎及经济扩张的主要根据地之一。

column1: It also became the government seat of Fengtian province in 1910.
column2: 在 1910 年，也成为奉天省的政府所在地。

column1: In 1914, the city changed back to its old name Shenyang, but continued to be known as Mukden (sometimes spelled Moukden) in some English sources and in Japan through much of the first half of 20th century.
column2: 1914 年，该市改回其旧名沈阳，但在 20 世纪上半叶的大部分时间里，一些英文资料和日本国内继续称之为奉天（有时拼为Moukden）。

column1: The postmark of the Chinese postal administration kept the spelling "MOUKDEN/奉天" for usage on international mails until the late 1920s.
column2: 中国邮政管理局在国际邮件的邮戳上一直保留“MOUKDEN/奉天”的写法，直至 20 世纪 20 年代末。

column1: After that, a Chinese–Manchurian bilingual type "SHENYANG (MUKDEN)/瀋陽 (奉天)" datestamp was used until 1933.
column2: 此后，“SHENYANG（MUKDEN）/沈阳（奉天）”的满汉双语日期戳一直使用至 1933 年。

column1: In the early 20th century, Shenyang began expanding out of its old city walls.
column2: 20 世纪初，沈阳开始向老城墙外扩张。

column1: The Shenyang Railway Station on the South Manchurian Railway and the Shenyang North Railway Station on the Jingfeng Railway, both west of the old city, became the new commercial centers of Shenyang.
column2: 南满铁路沈阳火车站和京奉铁路沈阳北站均位于老城西边，成为沈阳新的商业中心。

column1: In the 1920s, Mukden was the capital of the warlord Zhang Zuolin, who was later assassinated when his train was blown up on 4 June 1928 at a Japanese-guarded railway bridge.
column2: 20 世纪 20 年代，奉天是军阀张作霖的首府，1928 年 6 月 4 日，张作霖乘坐的火车在一座由日本人守卫的铁路桥上爆炸，遭暗杀身亡。

column1: At the time, several factories were built by Zhang to manufacture ammunition in the northern and eastern suburbs.
column2: 当时，张作霖在北郊和东郊建了多家工厂，生产弹药。

column1: These factories laid the foundation for Shenyang's industrial development.
column2: 这些工厂为沈阳的工业发展奠定了基础。

column1: At around 10:20 pm on 18 September 1931, a small quantity of dynamite was detonated close to a railway line near Mukden owned by the Japanese South Manchuria Railway Company by Kwantung Army Lt.
column2: 1931 年 9 月 18 日晚 10:20 左右，少量炸药在日本南满铁路公司拥有的奉天附近的一段铁路线旁被引爆，肇事者为关东军中尉

column1: Kawamoto Suemori.
column2: 河本末守。

column1: The Imperial Japanese Army, accusing Chinese dissidents of the act, then use the false flag explosion as pretext to launch a full attack on Mukden, and captured the city the following morning (September 19).
column2: 日本帝国陆军谴责中国持不同政见者做出此举，随后以假国旗爆炸为借口，对奉天发动全面进攻，并于次日上午（9 月 19 日）占领该城。

column1: After the Mukden Incident, the Japanese further invaded and occupied the rest of Northeast China, and created the puppet state of Manchukuo with the deposed emperor Aisin Gioro Puyi as the figurehead.
column2: “九·一八”事变后，日本进一步入侵并占领了中国东北其他地区，并建立了伪满洲国，以逊帝爱新觉罗·溥仪作为傀儡。

column1: During the Manchukuo era (1932–1945), the city was again called Fengtian (and Mukden in English), and was developed by the Japanese into a center of heavy industry.
column2: 在伪满时期（1932-1945 年），这座城市再次被称为奉天（英语Mukden），日本人将其发展成一个重工业中心。

column1: Japan was able to exploit resources in Manchuria using the extensive network of railroads.
column2: 日本可以利用四通八达的铁路网络，开发满洲资源。

column1: For example, vast expanses of Manchurian forest were chopped down.
column2: 例如，大片的满洲森林遭到砍伐。

column1: The development of Shenyang was also unbalanced in this period; municipal facilities were mostly located in Japanese residential areas, while Chinese residential areas had poor living conditions.
column2: 沈阳在这一时期的发展也不平衡，市政设施大多位于日本人居住区，而中国人居住区的生活条件较差。

column1: Under Marshal of the Soviet Union Aleksandr Vasilevsky, the Far East Command of Soviet forces entered Manchuria in early August 1945 following the surrender of Japan.
column2: 日本投降后，在苏联元帅亚历山大·华西列夫斯基的指挥下，苏联军队远东司令部于 1945 年 8 月初进入满洲。

column1: On 16 August 1945, Manchurian Emperor Puyi was captured in Shenyang Airport by the Soviet Red Army while he was in an airplane fleeing to Japan.
column2: 1945 年 8 月 16 日，伪满皇帝溥仪在沈阳机场被苏联红军抓获，当时他正在逃往日本的飞机上。

column1: On 20 August, Soviet troops captured Shenyang.
column2: 8 月 20 日，苏军占领沈阳。

column1: British and US reports indicate that the Soviet troops that occupied Northeast China and Eastern Inner Mongolia region looted and terrorized the people of Shenyang, and were not discouraged by Soviet authorities from "three days of rape and pillage".
column2: 英国和美国的报道表明，苏联军队占领了中国东北和内蒙古东部地区，对沈阳百姓进行劫掠和恐吓，并且不顾苏联当局劝阻，进行了“为期三天的强奸和抢劫”。

column1: The Soviets were replaced by the Nationalist Chinese, who were flown in on U.S. transport planes.
column2: 苏联人被乘坐美国运输机涌入的中国国民党所取代。

column1: During the Chinese Civil War, Shenyang remained a Kuomintang stronghold from 1946 to 1948, although the Chinese communists controlled the surrounding countryside.
column2: 国共内战期间，从 1946 年到 1948 年，沈阳一直是国民党根据地，但中国共产党控制了周围的农村地区。

column1: It was captured by the communists on October 30, 1948, following a series of offensives known as the Liaoshen Campaign.
column2: 经过辽沈战役的一系列进攻，1948 年 10 月 30 日，共产党攻占该城。

column1: Over the past 200 years or so, Shenyang managed to grow and increase its industrial might, despite consecutive wars with Russia and Japan in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, the Second World War, and China's Civil War (Shenyang became the main battleground between the Communists and Nationalists).
column2: 在过去 200 年左右的时间里，尽管经历了 19 世纪末 20 世纪初与日本和俄国接连开战、第二次世界大战、国共内战（沈阳是共产党和国民党之间的主战场），沈阳还是发展壮大了自己的工业实力。

column1: The old city of Shenyang resided almost entirely within the modern day Shenhe District, and used to have two city walls.
column2: 沈阳古城几乎完全位于现在的沈河区内，曾有两堵城墙。

column1: Situated roughly within the area bounded by the four "Shuncheng" (顺城; 'along the city walls') roads/streets in Shenhe District, the (now-demolished) square-shaped inner city wall marked the bounds of ancient Shenyang.
column2: 四方形的内城墙（现已拆除）大致位于沈河区以四条“顺城”路/街为界的区域内，标明了古沈阳的地界。

column1: The earliest wall was built in 926 during early Liao dynasty to settle Northern Song civilians the Khitans abducted from raids to use as slave labourers, and was then made of rammed earth because the city was merely a small settlement at the time (historically the administrative center of the Liaodong region was at Liaoyang).
column2: 最早的城墙建于辽代初期 926 年，用于安置在突袭中被契丹人掳走当作奴隶劳工的北宋平民，由于当时的城市只是一个小定居点（历史上辽东地区的行政中心位于辽阳），当时采用夯土建造。

column1: However, in 1368, Hongwu Emperor of the newly founded Ming dynasty ordered a new regional military command—the Liaodong Regional Military Commission (遼東都指揮使司)—to be established, and Shenyang was made a prominent regional "guard town" (衛所).
column2: 但在 1368 年，新建立的明朝的洪武皇帝下令建立一个新的地区军事指挥部——辽东都指挥使司，沈阳成为了著名的地区“卫所”。

column1: In 1388, Min Zhong (閔忠), the newly appointed city commissioner of the Shenyang Central Guard, wrote to Hongwu Emperor immediately upon his tenure requesting permission to upgrade the city wall, and the old wall was made taller and thoroughly reinforced with overlaid bricks.
column2: 1388 年，新任沈阳中卫城指挥使闵忠刚一上任就致信洪武皇帝，请求批准升级城墙，对旧城墙进行加高，并用覆土砖彻底加固。

column1: According to History of Ming, the reconstructed Ming-era wall was 2.5 zhàngs (8 metres or 26 feet) tall, more than 1 zhàng (3.2 metres or 10.5 feet) wide at the top, and 9 lis and 30 bus (about 5.2 kilometres or 3.2 miles) long.
column2: 据《明史》记载，重建的明城墙高 2.5 丈（8 米或 26 英尺），顶宽超过 1 丈（3.2 米或 10.5 英尺），长 9 里 30 步（约 5.2 公里或 3.2 英里）。

column1: It has two layers of moats dug outside, each being 3 zhàngs (9.6 metres or 31.5 feet) wide and 8 chis (2.56 metres or 8 feet 4.8 inches) deep, fed with water from Shen River.
column2: 墙外挖了两道护城河，各 3 丈（9.6 米或 31.5 英尺）宽，深 8 尺（2.56 米或 8 英尺 4.8 英寸），水源来自沈河。

column1: There were four city gates, each at the center of one side, connected by two main roads that intersected at Central Temple of the city's center in a "+" fashion.
column2: 有四扇城门，各位于每侧城墙正中，由两条主路相连，在城中心的中央庙十字相交。

column1: This Ming wall was heavily damaged in 1625 after the Manchu laid siege and captured the city, with only the north wall and gate (which had undergone reinforcing reconstructions in 1545 under the orders of Jiajing Emperor) remained intact.
column2: 1625 年，满族围攻占领该城后，明城墙遭到严重破坏，只有北面的城墙和城门（1545 年嘉靖皇帝下令加固重建）完好无损。

column1: The Manchu leader Nurhachi however saw the strategic value of the city, and decided to formally relocate his Later Jin capital from Liaoyang to Shenyang, and ordered the city wall to be rebuilt.
column2: 但满族领袖努尔哈赤看到了这座城市的战略价值，决定正式将他的后金都城从辽阳迁至沈阳，并下令重修城墙。

column1: According to Annals of Mukden (盛京通志), the new city wall was a standard black brick wall standing at a height of 3.5 zhàngs (about 12.5 metres or 41.0 feet), a width of 1.8 zhàngs (about 6.4 metres or 21.0 feet) and a total length of 9 lis and 332 bus (about 6.4 kilometres or 4.0 miles) long, complete with 12 towers (8 gate and 4 corner) and a 14.5 zhàngs (about 52-metre or 171-foot) wide moat.
column2: 据《盛京通志》记载，新城墙为标准青砖墙，高 3.5 丈（约 12.5 米或 41.0 英尺），宽 1.8 丈（约 6.4 米或 21.0 英尺），总长度 9 里 332 步（约 6.4 公里或 4.0 英里），有 12 座塔楼（8 门 4 角）和一条宽 14.5 丈（约 52 米或 171 英尺）的护城河。

column1: The city gates were increased from four to eight, though the old Ming-era north gate and tower was preserved but sealed shut, later known as the "Ninth Gate" (九門).
column2: 城门从四个增加到八个，虽然旧的明代北门和塔楼得以保留，但被封死，后来被称为“九门”。

column1: The outer city wall, called the "peripheral wall" (邊牆; Biān Qiáng) or "pass wall" (關牆; Guān Qiáng), was actually a rammed earth rampart built in 1680 to expand the urban area outside the inner city.
column2: 外城墙称为“边墙”或“关墙”，实际上是建于 1680 年的一道夯土墙，向内城之外扩大城市区域。

column1: It was almost round in shape, standing at a height of 7.5 chis (around 2.7 metres or 8 feet 10.3 inches) and an overall length of 32 lis and 24 bus (about 20.7 kilometres or 12.9 miles), and also had eight gates known as the "peripheral gates" (邊門; Biān Mén).
column2: 几乎为圆形，高 7.5 尺（约 2.7 米或 8 英尺 10.3 英寸），总长 32 里 24 步（约 20.7 公里或 12.9 英里），也有八个门，称为“边门”。

column1: The corresponding inner and outer gates were linked by roads that intersected within the inner city in a "#" pattern around the Mukden Palace.
column2: 对应的内外城门以道路相连，这些路在沈阳故宫周围相交成“井”字形。

column1: Nearly all of these city walls and gates were demolished after 1949.
column2: 几乎所有这些城墙和城门都在 1949 年后被拆除。

column1: Two gates and one corner tower of the inner wall were rebuilt during the 1990s.
column2: 20 世纪 90 年代，重建了内城的两个城门和一座角楼。

column1: There had, however, been proposals to rebuild the other gates and towers in preparation to the 12th National Games in 2013.
column2: 但是，曾有人提议重建其他城门和城楼，以迎接 2013 年的第十二届全运会。

column1: Around 2.5 km (1.6 mi) outside Shenyang's former outer wall, there were four pagodas each located within an associated Tibetan buddhist temple, namely the East Pagoda in Yongguang Temple (永光寺), the South Pagoda in Guangci Temple (廣慈寺), the West Pagoda in Yanshou Temple (延壽寺) and the North Pagoda in Falun Temple (法輪寺).
column2: 沈阳原外城墙外约 2.5 公里（1.6 英里）处，有四座宝塔，每座塔都坐落在相关的藏传佛教寺庙内，即永光寺东塔、广慈寺南塔、延寿寺西塔和法轮寺北塔。

column1: They were built in 1643 and completed in 1645.
column2: 这些塔于 1643 年开建，1645 年建成。

column1: The four pagodas are identical white Buddha-stupas as tall as 26 m (85 ft).
column2: 这四座宝塔为一模一样的白色佛塔，高 26 米（85 英尺）。

column1: Nowadays only the temple for the North Pagoda is well preserved, the East and South has only the pagodas left, and the temple for the West Pagoda was rebuilt in 1998.
column2: 现在只有北塔的寺庙保存完好，东塔和南塔只剩塔体，西塔寺庙于 1998 年重建。

column1: Both the Temple of Heaven and Temple of Earth were also to be found in the old city during the Qing dynasty.
column2: 清代时也曾在古城中发现天坛和地坛。

column1: They were smaller replicas of Beijing's counterparts.
column2: 是北京天坛和地坛的小型复制品。

column1: Neither exists today.
column2: 如今都不复存在。

column1: Shenyang ranges in latitude from 41° 11' to 43° 02' N and in longitude from 122° 25' to 123° 48' E, and is located in the central part of Liaoning province.
column2: 沈阳的纬度为北纬 41°11' 至 43°02'，经度为东经 122°25' 至 123°48'，位于辽宁省中部。

column1: The western parts of the city's administrative area are located on the alluvial plain of the Liao River system, while the eastern part consists of the hinterlands of the Changbai Mountains, and is covered with forests.
column2: 城市行政区域的西部位于辽河水系冲积平原上，而东部由长白山腹地组成，被森林覆盖。

column1: The highest point in Shenyang is 414 m (1,358 ft) above sea level and the lowest point only 7 m (23 ft).
column2: 沈阳的最高点海拔 414 米（1358 英尺），最低点仅 7 米（23 英尺）。

column1: The average elevation of the urban area is 45 m (148 ft).
column2: 城区平均海拔为 45 米（148 英尺）。

column1: The city's main urban area is located to the north of Hun River, formerly the largest tributary of the Liao River proper and often locally referred as the city's "mother river".
column2: 该城的主要城区位于浑河北岸，浑河曾是辽河最大的支流，常被当地人称为这座城市的“母亲河”。

column1: The central urban area is surrounded by three artificial rivers—respectively the South Canal (南运河) from the south and southeast, the Xinkai River (新开河, formerly the North Canal) from the north and northeast, and the Weigong River (卫工河, formerly the Weigong Nullah) from the west, all interconnected by channels as a continuous waterway.

column1: The South Canal in particular, famous for the series of linear parks and gardens along it, was constructed upon the old course of the Wanquan River (萬泉河; 'ten thousand springs river'), historically also called the Little Shen River (小瀋水) or Wuli River (五里河; 'five-li river'), which was a principal water source for the old city.  These are reinforced on the peripheries by smaller rivers such as Xi River (细河), Puhe River (蒲河) and Mantang River (满堂河), and drains into the Hun River at three different locations on the southeast, due south and southwest side of the city.

column2: 1947 年，由于发生二二八事件，蒋介石领导的国民党政府宣布实行全岛戒严。二二八事件起源于台北，但最终导致蒋介石的军队镇压全岛民众。

column1: Two years later, on 7 December 1949, Chiang and the Kuomintang forces were forced to flee mainland China by the Communists near the end of the Chinese Civil War.

column1: In 1990 Taipei's 16 districts were consolidated into the current 12 districts.

column1: The generally low-lying terrain of the central areas on the western side of the municipality slopes upward to the south and east and especially to the north, where it reaches 1,120 metres (3,675 ft) at Qixing Mountain, the highest (inactive) volcano in Taiwan in Yangmingshan National Park.
column2: 该市西部的中央地区地势较低，地势向南向东和向北逐渐升高，特别是北部的七星山海拔达到 1,120 米（3,675 英尺），这是台湾最高的（休眠）火山，位于阳明山国家公园。

column1: The northern districts of Shilin and Beitou extend north of the Keelung River and are bordered by Yangmingshan National Park.
column2: 北部的士林区和北投区延伸至基隆河北边，毗邻阳明山国家公园。

column1: The Taipei city limits cover an area of 271.7997 km² (104.9425 sq mi), ranking sixteenth of twenty-five among all counties and cities in Taiwan.
column2: 台北市面积为 271.7997 平方公里（104.9425 平方英里），在全台湾二十五个县市中排行第十六。

column2: 两座山峰，七星山和山

column1: Datun, rise to the northeast of the city.
column2: 大屯，位于城市的东北部。

column1: Qixing Mountain is located on the Tatun Volcano Group and the tallest mountain at the rim of the Taipei Basin, with its main peak at 1,120 metres (3,670 ft).
column2: 七星山位于大屯火山群，是台北盆地边缘最高的山脉，主峰海拔 1,120 米（3,670 英尺）。

column1: Datun's main peak is 1,092 metres (3,583 ft).
column2: 大屯主峰海拔 1,092 米（3,583 英尺）。

column2: 这些前火山位于阳明山国家公园的西部，从山延伸至

column1: Caigongkeng (菜公坑山).
column2: 菜公坑山。

column1: Located on a broad saddle between two mountains, the area also contains the marshy Datun Pond.
column2: 该区域位于两山之间的鞍部，此处还有泥泞的大屯池。

column1: To the southeast of the city lie the Songshan Hills and the Qingshui Ravine, which form a barrier of lush woods.
column2: 城市的东南部有松山和清水谷，形成了一道茂密树立的隔断。

column1: When compared to other Asian cities, Taipei has "excellent" capabilities for managing air quality in the city.
column2: 与其他亚洲城市相比，台北拥有“很棒”的城市空气质量治理能力。

column1: Its rainy climate, location near the coast, and strong environmental regulations have prevented air pollution from becoming a substantial health issue, at least compared to cities in southeast Asia and industrial China.
column2: 由于其气候多雨、位置近海、环境法规严格，因此至少与东南亚和工业化中国城市相比，空气污染没有成为严重的健康问题。

column1: However, smog is extremely common and there is poor visibility throughout the city after rain-less days.
column2: 但是，雾霾非常普遍，城市在雨水少的日子后能见度很低。

column1: Motor vehicle engine exhaust, particularly from motor scooters, is a source of air pollution in Taipei.
column2: 机动车（特别是摩托车）引擎排放的废气是台北空气污染的来源。

column1: There are higher levels of fine particulate matter and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in the mornings because of less air movement; sunlight reduces some pollution.
column2: 由于早上空气流动缓慢，空气中有较高浓度的细颗粒物和多环芳烃；阳光可减少部分污染。

column1: As Taiwan's business, financial, and technology hub, Taipei has been at the center of rapid economic development in the country and has now become one of the global cities in technology and electronics.
column2: 台北作为台湾的商业、金融和科技中心，已经成为该地区经济快速发展的中心，现已成为全球科技与电子城市之一。

column1: This development is part of the so-called Taiwan Miracle which has seen dramatic growth in the city following foreign direct investment in the 1960s.
column2: 这段发展是所谓的台湾奇迹的一部分，在 20 世纪 60 年引入外商直接投资后，城市经历了迅猛发展。

column1: Taiwan is now a creditor economy, holding one of the world's largest foreign exchange reserves of over US$403 billion as of December 2012.
column2: 台湾现在是债权经济体，截至 2012 年 12 月为止，拥有世界上最大的外汇储备之一，总额超过 4030 亿美元。

column1: Despite the Asian financial crisis, the economy continues to expand at about 5% per year, with virtually full employment and low inflation.
column2: 虽然亚洲爆发了金融危机，但该经济体继续保持每年 5% 的增长，几乎没有人失业，通货膨胀率低。

column1: The city's GDP stand at US$327 billion in 2014.
column2: 2014 年，该城市的 GDP 达到 3270 亿美元。

column1: As of 2013, the nominal GDP per capita in Taipei city is 5th highest in East Asia, behind Tokyo, Singapore, Osaka, and Hong Kong, but ahead of Seoul, as well as London and Paris, according to The Economist.
column2: 根据《经济学人》报道，到 2013 年为止，台北市的名义人均 GDP 在东亚排名第五，仅次于东京、新加坡、大阪和香港，但比首尔以及伦敦和巴黎高。

column1: GDP per capita based on Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) in Taipei in 2015 was US$44173, behind that of Singapore (US$90151 in 2016 from the IMF) and Hong Kong (US$58322 in 2016 from the IMF; also based on PPP).
column2: 2015 年，台北基于购买力平价（PPP）计算的人均 GDP 为 44173 美元，仅次于新加坡（根据国际货币基金组织数据，2016 年为 90151 美元）和香港（根据国际货币基金组织数据，2016 年为 58322 美元；基于购买力平价计算）。

column1: The Financial Times ranked Taipei highly in economic potential (2nd, behind Tokyo) and business friendliness (4th) in 2015.
column2: 2015 年，《金融时报》将台北列入经济潜力（第 2 名，仅次于东京）和营商友好度（第 4 名）的前位。

column1: The city is home to 30 billionaires, the 16th most in the world, ahead of many global cities such as Los Angeles and Sydney.
column2: 该城市有 30 名亿万富翁，人数排名全世界第 16，超过洛杉矶和悉尼等许多国际城市。

column1: Business Insider also ranks Taipei the 5th most high-tech city globally, the highest in Asia, in 2017.
column2: 2017 年，《商业内幕》也把台北列为全球第五大高科技城市，亚洲城市中排名最高。

column1: While the IESE Cities in Motion Index 2017 ranks Taipei as the smartest technology city globally.
column2: 2017年 IESE 动态城市指数把台北列为全球最智能的科技城市。

column1: Taipei's main development fields include the information and communications technology (hardware and software), biotechnology, general merchandising (wholesale/retail), financial services, and MICE industries.
column2: 台北的主要发展领域包括信息与通讯技术（硬件及软件）、生物技术、日用百货（批发/零售）、金融服务和会展产业。

column1: Most of the country's major firms are based there including Asus, CTBC Bank, Fubon Financial Holding, Tatung Company, D-Link, and others.
column2: 该地区大部分大型企业的总部都设于此，包括华硕、中国信托商业银行、富邦金融控股公司、大同公司、友讯科技等。

column1: 5 Global Fortune 500 companies are headquartered in Taipei.
column2: 5 个全球财富 500 强企业的总部都在台北。

column1: The city also attracts many multi-national corporations, international financial institutions, foreign consulates, and business organizations to set up base there.
column2: 该城市也吸引了许多跨国企业、国际金融机构、外国领事馆和商业组织到此设立总部。

column1: Thus, Taipei has nearly 3,500 registered foreign businesses and attracts over 50% of the total foreign investment in Taiwan.
column2: 因此，台北有将近 3,500 家注册外国企业，吸引的外资占台湾外资总额的 50%。

column1: Foreign companies with offices or regional headquarters in Taipei include Google, Microsoft, IBM, Intel, HSBC, Citibank, Facebook, Amazon, Apple, JP Morgan, PwC, and many others.
column2: 在台北设有办公室或地区总部的外国企业包括谷歌、微软、IBM、因特尔、汇丰银行、花旗银行、Facebook、亚马逊、Apple、摩根大通、普华永道等。

column1: Most financial and foreign firms like to reside in the central business district of Taipei, the Xinyi Special District.
column2: 大多数金融和外国企业都喜欢将办公室设在台北中央商业区，即信义计划区。

column1: With Citi, JP Morgan, DBS Bank, Cathay Life Insurance, Shin Kong Commercial Bank, Hua Nan Bank, and soon Fubon Financial and Nan Shan Life Insurance all establishing skyscrapers in the area.
column2: 花旗银行、摩根大通、星展银行、国泰人寿、星光商业银行、华南银行以及富邦金融和南山人寿纷纷在此区域建起摩天大楼。

column1: Meanwhile, technology and electronics companies are often colocated in the Neihu Technology Park or the Nankang Software Park.
column2: 同时，科技与电子公司通常搬往内湖科技园区或南港软体园区。

column1: The startup and innovation scene in Taipei is also very vibrant.
column2: 台北的创业及创新领域也蓬勃发展。

column1: In 2018 alone, Microsoft announced plans to invest US$34 million to create an artificial intelligence R&D center in Taipei, while Google announced it will hire 300 people and train 5,000 more in artificial intelligence for machines.
column2: 仅 2018 年，微软宣布计划投资 340 万美元，在台北创建人工智能研发中心，谷歌也宣布将在机器人工智能方面聘用 300 名员工和培训超过 5,000 名员工。

column1: Taipei is currently Google's biggest engineering site in Asia.
column2: 台北现在是谷歌在亚洲最大的工程地。

column1: IBM also announced in 2018 that it will develop a cloud research lab and expand its R&D center in Taipei with eyes on artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, and cloud computing.
column2: 2018 年，IBM 也宣布建立云研究实验室，并扩张其在台北的研发中心，专注于研究人工智能、区块链技术和云计算。

column1: According to the 2016 Global Entrepreneurship Development Index, Taipei's entrepreneurial spirit ranks 6th worldwide and 1st in Asia.
column2: 根据 2016 全球创业精神暨发展指数，台北的创业精神位列全球第 6 名，亚洲第 1 名。

column1: Taipei has more than 400 startups and numerous incubation centers, accelerators, venture capitals, and angel investors.
column2: 台北有超过 400 家初创企业和许多孵化中心、加速器、风险资本和天使投资者。

column1: The city's startup ecosystem is valued at US$580 million by Startup Genome in 2018.
column2: Startup Genome 2018 年的数据显示，该城市初创生态系统价值 5.8 亿美元。

column1: Tourism is a small but significant component of the local economy with international visitors totaling almost 3 million in 2008. Taipei has many top tourist attractions and contributes a significant amount to the US$6.8 billion tourism industry in Taiwan.
column2: 旅游业是当地经济占比较小但很重要的组成部分，2008 年境外游客总人数达到将近三百万。台北有许多受欢迎的旅游景点，为台湾旅游业贡献了 68 亿美元的巨额收入。

column1: Tourism is a major part of Taipei's economy.
column2: 旅游业是台北经济的主要组成部分。

column1: In 2013, over 6.3 million overseas visitors visited Taipei, making the city the 15th most visited globally.
column2: 2013 年，超过 630 万海外游客到访台北，台北在全球游客人数排名中位列第 15。

column1: The influx of visitors contributed US$10.8 billion to the city's economy in 2013, the 9th highest in the world and the most of any city in the Chinese-speaking world.
column2: 2013 年，到访游客为该城市的经济贡献了 108 亿美元收入，全球排名第 9 位，在中文世界城市中排名第一。

column1: The National Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall is a famous monument, landmark and tourist attraction that was erected in memory of General Chiang Kai-shek, former President of the Republic of China.
column2: 中正纪念堂是闻名的纪念馆、地标和景点，为纪念中华民国前总统蒋介石将军而建。

column1: The structure stands at the east end of Memorial Hall Square, site of the National Concert Hall and National Theater and their adjacent parks as well as the memorial.
column2: 雕像立于纪念堂广场西边，即国家音乐厅与国家戏剧院和邻近公园以及纪念堂的交汇处。

column1: The landmarks of Liberty Square stand within sight of Taiwan's Presidential Office Building in Taipei's Zhongzheng District.
column2: 自由广场地标就位于台北中正区台湾总统府视野范围内。
